nl: If x is greater than y, and y is greater than z, then x is greater than z. x is 5, y is 3, z is 1. Is x greater than z?
If a plus b equals c, and a is 2 and b is 3, then c is 5. Is this valid?
a is less than b. b is less than c. c is less than d. Therefore, a is less than d.
x equals y. y equals z. Therefore, x equals z.
a is greater than b. c is greater than d. Therefore, a is greater than d.
All even numbers are divisible by 2. 4 is an even number. Therefore, 4 is divisible by 2.
No prime number is composite. 7 is a prime number. Therefore, 7 is not composite.
All squares of real numbers are non-negative. x squared is a square. Therefore, x squared is non-negative.
If the product of two numbers is zero, then at least one of them is zero. The product of a and b is zero. Therefore, a is zero or b is zero.
All positive numbers are greater than zero. x is greater than zero. Therefore, x is positive.
For all numbers, a plus b equals b plus a. Therefore, 3 plus 5 equals 5 plus 3.
Any number multiplied by zero equals zero. x is a number. Therefore, x times zero equals zero.
a is greater than b. a equals b. This is valid.
The negative of a negative number is positive. -(-5) is the negative of a negative. Therefore, -(-5) is positive.
The absolute value of any number is non-negative. |x| is an absolute value. Therefore, |x| is non-negative.
